At the same time, they favor visualizing savings goals, for instance, by tracking progress through an app to enhance their sense of achievement. Additionally, users are open to trying short-term, adjustable budget allocation methods to flexibly modify plans based on actual circumstances. Lastly, they appreciate savings strategies that incorporate reward mechanisms, such as allowing themselves to purchase a desired item after reaching a savings goal.
preference.neg: Users tend to reject financial management tools that require high self-discipline and detailed recording of every expense, as such demands conflict with their lower sense of responsibility, making it easy for them to give up halfway. They also dislike mandatory large-sum savings plans, as such schemes may cause excessive stress and negatively impact their quality of life. Furthermore, overly theoretical or complex investment advice is seen as impractical and fails to capture their interest. Lastly, any plan that requires sacrificing family financial support to prioritize personal savings will be met with opposition.

preference.pos: Users tend to prefer video calling software with simple interfaces and intuitive features, especially those that support multi-person online interaction, making it convenient for group communication with family. Additionally, she is open to trying regular reminder features to help her develop a habit of contacting family members consistently. Lastly, she appreciates platforms that integrate various media formats (such as photo and video sharing) to make communication richer and more engaging.
preference.neg: Users tend to reject applications that require frequent version updates or learning new operational procedures, as these conflict with their moderate openness and low conscientiousness, easily leading to frustration. They also dislike solutions that rely on specific equipment for high-quality calls, such as expensive professional cameras or microphones, which exceed their actual needs and budget. Additionally, communication methods overly dependent on real-time interaction (such as live-streaming apps) are perceived as lacking flexibility and freedom, thus evoking resistance. Finally, any service requiring additional high costs to enhance the experience is viewed as an unnecessary expense.

family-3.requirement: Planning time for visiting relatives and companionship

preference.pos: Users tend to create clear visiting schedules in advance, such as traveling during off-peak holiday periods to save costs while ensuring sufficient time with family. They prefer using calendar tools to mark important dates (like returning home for the Spring Festival) and setting reminders to avoid forgetting. Additionally, users are open to segmented visiting plans—making multiple short trips home each year rather than one long stay—making it easier to balance work and family commitments. Finally, they appreciate plans that include backup options, such as how to quickly adjust itineraries in case of unexpected situations.
preference.neg: The user would reject relying entirely on impromptu family visit arrangements, as this contradicts her trait of low conscientiousness and could easily lead to failed plans. She also dislikes complex itinerary designs that require extensive preliminary preparation or excessive effort, such as travel plans involving multiple city transfers, which would leave her feeling exhausted. Additionally, overly idealized scheduling of companionship time—such as assuming she has free time to call every day—would be viewed by her as unrealistic and impractical to implement. Finally, any suggestions demanding significant changes to her current lifestyle would be met with opposition, as she prioritizes gradual adjustments.

preference.pos: Users tend to install smart health monitoring devices, such as blood pressure monitors or heart rate wristbands, to help their parents keep track of their physical condition and receive timely updates. They also prefer establishing fixed channels for sharing health information, such as weekly family group chats to report health updates, which provides them with peace of mind. Additionally, users are willing to participate in online medical consultation platforms, booking expert appointments for their parents to reduce the hassle of waiting in line at hospitals. Finally, they appreciate the value-added health management services offered by insurance companies, such as free health check-ups or wellness seminars, which help raise health awareness for the entire family.
preference.neg: The user would reject suggestions that rely solely on phone calls to inquire about their parents' health, as this method provides limited information and is prone to missing critical details, failing to effectively alleviate their concerns. They also dislike health knowledge courses that require significant time and effort to study, finding such content overly lengthy and tedious. Additionally, any psychological adjustment plans that emphasize "maintaining an optimistic mindset" but lack practical guidance for action would be viewed as useless. Finally, the user would be averse to the promotion of expensive yet low-value health products, such as unverified health supplements or therapeutic devices.
